main event: 1st Lt. Robert V. Meyers, a P-47 pilot, sighted an unidentified flying object resembling a flying wing over the Philippine Islands on 1 April 1948.
interesting points: The object was silver in color and estimated to be 30 feet in wingspan and 20 feet in length., Lt. Meyers was leading a flight of three other aircraft and first spotted the object approximately three miles away at 1000 feet altitude., The object displayed great acceleration, disappearing from sight in about 5 seconds., There was no sound detected from the object during the sighting., Lt. Meyers was the only witness to the incident, as he could not contact his wingmen due to radio issues.
witness description: 1st Lt. Robert V. Meyers, P-47 pilot
